page.title: 07Old people in Wantage (1)
page.content: On our walk from Charlton we were surprised to see so many houses for old people. 1.St.Katharine's House is privately run by St. Mary's Convent(Anglican) There is provision for 60 ladies over the age of 70 and for 10 elderly nuns. 2. In 1830 in his will Thomas Fewson Eagles left 1 acre of land to be used for building almshouses.In 1860 ten were erected.According to the will the occupants should be single,not under 50, residents of Wantage,and not rich. They are administered by the Governors of the Town Lands.People pay rent now. We took harvest gifts to them last year. 3.Stirlings Home is run by Oxfordshire County Council for 30 old people who can wash and dress themselves but are not able to cook.
